medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe early-onset obesity, adrenal insufficiency, and red hair.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early life. The male patient from Slovenia was diagnosed in the first weeks of life due to hypoglycemia and convulsions. The male from the Netherlands had low serum glucose levels on the second day of life, resolved after oral glucose, followed by convulsions at 4 weeks. The female from Switzerland had a normal neonatal period until convulsions in the sixth month indicated hypoglycemia due to isolated ACTH deficiency. Hyperphagic behavior was reported by parents from the first weeks of life.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All patients diagnosed with complete loss-of-function mutations of the POMC gene, experienced extreme obesity within the first year of life despite normal birth weights.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were heterozygous for POMC mutations, showing high normal or mildly elevated body weight, suggesting a dosage effect.
